{
  "article_text": [
    "the investigation of relativistic cosmological models usually has the energy momentum tensor of matter generated by a perfect fluid . to consider more realistic models",
    ", one must take into account the viscosity mechanisms , which have already attracted attention of many researchers .",
    "misner @xcite suggested that strong dissipative due to the neutrino viscosity may considerably reduce the anisotropy of the black - body radiation .",
    "viscosity mechanism in cosmology can explain the anomalously high entropy per baryon in the present universe @xcite .",
    "bulk viscosity associated with the grand - unified - theory phase transition @xcite may lead to an inflationary scenario @xcite .",
    "a uniform cosmological model filled with fluid which possesses pressure and second ( bulk ) viscosity was developed by murphy @xcite .",
    "the solutions that he found exhibit an interesting feature that the big bang type singularity appears in the infinite past .",
    "exact solutions of the isotropic homogeneous cosmology for open , closed and flat universe have been found by santos et al @xcite , with the bulk viscosity being a power function of energy density .",
    "the nature of cosmological solutions for homogeneous bianchi type i ( bi ) model was investigated by belinsky and khalatnikov @xcite by taking into account a dissipative process due to viscosity .",
    "they showed that viscosity can not remove the cosmological singularity but results in a qualitatively new behavior of the solutions near singularity .",
    "they found the remarkable property that during the time of the _ big bang _",
    "matter is created by the gravitational field .",
    "bi solutions in case of stiff matter with a shear viscosity being the power function of of energy density were obtained by banerjee @xcite , whereas bi models with bulk viscosity ( @xmath9 ) that is a power function of energy density @xmath8 and when the universe is filled with stiff matter were studied by huang @xcite .",
    "the effect of bulk viscosity , with a time varying bulk viscous coefficient , on the evolution of isotropic frw models was investigated in the context of open thermodynamics system was studied by desikan @xcite .",
    "this study was further developed by krori and mukherjee @xcite for anisotropic bianchi models .",
    "cosmological solutions with nonlinear bulk viscosity were obtained in @xcite .",
    "models with both shear and bulk viscosity were investigated in @xcite .    though murphy @xcite claimed that the introduction of bulk viscosity can avoid the initial singularity at finite past , results obtained in @xcite show that , it is , in general , not valid , since for some cases big bang singularity occurs in finite past . to eliminate the initial singularities a self - consistent system of nonlinear spinor and bi gravitational field was considered by us in a series of papers @xcite .",
    "for some cases we were able to find field ( both matter and gravitational ) configurations those were always regular . in the papers mentioned above we considered the system of interacting nonlinear spinor and/or scalar fields in a bi universe filled with perfect fluid .",
    "we also study the above system in presence of cosmological constant @xmath10 ( both constant and time varying @xcite ) . a nonlinear spinor field ,",
    "suggested by the symmetric coupling between nucleons , muons , and leptons , has been investigated by finkelstein et .",
    "@xcite in the classical approximation .",
    "although the existence of spin-@xmath11 fermion is both theoretically and experimentally undisputed , these are described by _",
    "quantum _ spinor fields .",
    "possible justifications for the existence of classical spinors has been addressed in @xcite . in view of what has been mentioned above",
    ", it would be interesting to study the influence of viscous fluid to the system of material ( say spinor and/or scalar ) and bi gravitational fields in presence of a @xmath10-term as well . in a recent paper we studied the bianchi type - i universe filled with viscous fluid in presence of a @xmath10 term @xcite .",
    "this study was further developed in @xcite where we present qualitative analysis of the corresponding system of equations .",
    "finally in @xcite we introduced spinor field into the system and solved the system for some special choice of viscosity .",
    "the purpose of this paper is to further developed those results for more general cases and give some numerical results .",
    "it should be noted the in the process there occurs a very rich system of equations for volume scale , hubble constant and energy density .",
    "the qualitative analysis of this system is under active study and we plan to present those results soon .",
    "in this section we derive the fundamental equations for the interacting spinor , scalar and gravitational fields from the action and write their solutions in term of the volume scale @xmath7 defined bellow .",
    "we also derive the equation for @xmath7 which plays the central role here .",
    "we consider a system of nonlinear spinor , scalar and bi gravitational field in presence of perfect fluid given by the action @xmath12 with @xmath13 the gravitational part of the lagrangian is given by a bianchi type i ( bi hereafter ) space - time , whereas @xmath14 describes the spinor field lagrangian and @xmath15 stands for the lagrangian density of viscous fluid .      for a spinor field @xmath16 , symmetry between @xmath16 and @xmath17 appears to demand that one should choose the symmetrized lagrangian   @xcite .",
    "keep it in mind we choose the spinor field lagrangian as @xmath18 - m{\\bar \\psi}{\\psi}+ \\lambda f ,   \\label{nlspin}\\ ] ] here @xmath19 is the spinor mass , @xmath1 is the self - coupling constant and @xmath20 with @xmath21 and @xmath22 . according to the pauli - fierz theorem @xcite among the five invariants",
    "only @xmath3 and @xmath4 are independent as all other can be expressed by them : @xmath23 and @xmath24 therefore , the choice @xmath25 , describes the nonlinearity in the most general of its form @xcite . note that setting @xmath26 in we come to the case with linear spinor field .      as a gravitational field",
    "we consider the bianchi type i ( bi ) cosmological model .",
    "it is the simplest model of anisotropic universe that describes a homogeneous and spatially flat space - time and if filled with perfect fluid with the equation of state @xmath27 , it eventually evolves into a frw universe @xcite .",
    "the isotropy of present - day universe makes bi model a prime candidate for studying the possible effects of an anisotropy in the early universe on modern - day data observations . in view of what has been mentioned above",
    "we choose the gravitational part of the lagrangian in the form @xmath28 where @xmath29 is the scalar curvature , @xmath30 being the einstein s gravitational constant .",
    "the gravitational field in our case is given by a bianchi type i ( bi ) metric @xmath31 with @xmath32 being the functions of time @xmath33 only . here the speed of light is taken to be unity .",
    "let us now write the field equations corresponding to the action .",

    "we study the space - independent solutions to the spinor field equations so that @xmath67 . here",

    "b(t ) & = & ( d_{1}^{2}d_{3})^{-1/3}\\tau^{1/3}\\exp \\biggl[-\\frac{2 x_1 + x_3 } { 3 } \\int\\,\\frac{e^{-2 \\kappa \\int \\eta dt } } { \\tau ( t ) } dt \\biggr ] , \\label{b } \\\\",
    "c(t ) & = & ( d_{1}d_{3}^{2})^{1/3}\\tau^{1/3}\\exp \\biggl[\\frac{x_1 + 2 x_3 } { 3 } \\int\\,\\frac{e^{-2 \\kappa \\int \\eta dt}}{\\tau ( t ) } dt \\biggr ] . \\label{c}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    as one sees from , and , for @xmath96 with @xmath97 the exponent tends to unity at large @xmath33 , and the anisotropic model becomes isotropic one .",
    "further we will investigate the existence of singularity ( singular point ) of the gravitational case , which can be done by investigating the invariant characteristics of the space - time .",
    "in general relativity these invariants are composed from the curvature tensor and the metric one . in a 4d riemann space - time",
    "there are 14 independent invariants . instead of analyzing all 14 invariants",
    ", one can confine this study only in 3 , namely the scalar curvature @xmath98 , @xmath99 , and the kretschmann scalar @xmath100 . at any regular space - time point , these three invariants @xmath101 should be finite .",
    "one can easily verify that @xmath102 thus we see that at any space - time point , where @xmath103 the invariants @xmath101 , as well as the scalar and spinor fields become infinity , hence the space - time becomes singular at this point .    in what follows",
    ", we write the equation for @xmath7 and study it in details .",
    "summation of einstein equations , , and multiplied by 3 gives @xmath104 which can be rearranged as @xmath105 for the right - hand - side of to be a function of @xmath7 only , the solution to this equation is well - known  @xcite .",

    "we explicitly solve eqs . and for some concrete value of @xmath2 .",
    "the eqs . can be written in terms of dynamical scalar as well .",

    "coincide with the ones given in @xcite .",
    "in this section we first solve the spinor field equations for some special choice of @xmath2 , which will be given in terms of @xmath7 .",
    "thereafter , we will study the system in details and give explicit solution for some special cases .",
    "as one sees , introduction of viscous fluid has no direct effect on the system of spinor field equations .",
    "viscous fluid has an implicit influence on the system through @xmath7 .",
    "a detailed analysis of the system in question can be found in @xcite .",
    "here we just write the final results .      here",
    "we consider the case when the nonlinear spinor field is given by @xmath130 as in the case with minimal coupling from one finds @xmath131 for components of spinor field we find  @xcite @xmath132 with @xmath133 being the integration constants and are related to @xmath134 as @xmath135 here @xmath136 .",
    "for the components of the spin current from we find @xmath137,\\quad j^1 = \\frac{2}{a\\tau } \\bigl[c_{1 } c_{4 } + c_{2 } c_{3}\\bigr ] \\cos ( 2\\beta ) , \\nonumber \\\\ j^2 & = & \\frac{2}{b\\tau } \\bigl[c_{1 } c_{4 } - c_{2 } c_{3}\\bigr ] \\sin ( 2\\beta),\\quad j^3 = \\frac{2}{c\\tau } \\bigl[c_{1 } c_{3 } - c_{2 } c_{4}\\bigr ] \\cos ( 2\\beta ) , \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] whereas , for the projection of spin vectors on the @xmath138 , @xmath139 and @xmath140 axis we find @xmath141 the total charge of the system in a volume @xmath142 in this case is @xmath143 { \\mathcal}{v}.\\ ] ] thus , for @xmath144 the components of spin current and the projection of spin vectors are singularity - free and the total charge of the system in a finite volume is always finite .",
    "note that , setting @xmath26 , i.e. , @xmath145 in the foregoing expressions one get the results for the linear spinor field .      here",
    "we consider the case with @xmath147 in this case we assume the spinor field to be massless .",
    "note that , in the unified nonlinear spinor theory of heisenberg , the massive term remains absent , and according to heisenberg , the particle mass should be obtained as a result of quantization of spinor prematter   @xcite . in the nonlinear generalization of classical field equations ,",
    "the massive term does not possess the significance that it possesses in the linear one , as it by no means defines total energy ( or mass ) of the nonlinear field system .",
    "thus without losing the generality we can consider massless spinor field putting @xmath148 then from one gets @xmath149 in this case the spinor field components take the form @xmath150 the integration constants @xmath151 are connected to @xmath152 by @xmath153 here we set @xmath154 .    for the components of the spin current from we find",
    "@xmath155,\\quad j^1 = \\frac{4}{a\\tau } \\bigl[d_{2 } d_{3 } + d_{1 } d_{4}\\bigr ] \\cos ( 2 \\sigma ) , \\nonumber\\\\ j^2 & = & \\frac{4}{b\\tau } \\bigl[d_{2 } d_{3 } - d_{1 } d_{4}\\bigr ] \\sin ( 2 \\sigma),\\quad j^3 = \\frac{4}{c\\tau } \\bigl[d_{1 } d_{3 } - d_{2 } d_{4}\\bigr ] \\cos ( 2 \\sigma ) , \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] whereas , for the projection of spin vectors on the @xmath138 , @xmath139 and @xmath140 axis we find @xmath156 we see that for any nontrivial @xmath7 as in previous case the components of spin current and the projection of spin vectors are singularity - free and the total charge of the system in a finite volume is always finite .      in this subsection",

    "the system without spinor field have been extensively studied in literature either partially @xcite or as a whole @xcite .",
    "here we try to solve the system for some particular choice of parameters .",
    "let us first consider the case with bulk viscosity alone setting coefficient of shear viscosity @xmath172 .",

    "as one sees , the right hand side of the eq . is a function of @xmath7 , hence can be solved in quadrature @xcite .",

    "it can be noted that the eq . can be viewed as one describing the motion of a single particle .",

    "let us consider a more general case .",
    "following @xcite we choose the shear viscosity being proportional to the expansion , namely , @xmath187 in absence of spinor field this assumption leads to @xmath188 it can be shown that the relation in our case can be achieved only for massless spinor field with the nonlinear term being @xmath189 equation for @xmath7 in this case has the form @xmath190 \\tau^2 = 0 .",
    "\\label{sbvtau}\\ ] ] in case of @xmath191 and @xmath26 there exists several special solutions available in handbooks on differential equations .",
    "but for nonzero @xmath1 we can investigate this equation only numerically .",
    "we consider the case when the bulk viscosity is given by a constant . taking this into account for problem parameters we set @xmath181 , @xmath192 , @xmath193 , @xmath180 and @xmath194 .",
    "we study the role of @xmath10 term . in doing this",
    "we consider the cases with positive , negative and trivial @xmath10 .",
    "since the nonlinear term in this case depends of @xmath195 , we also consider the cases with different @xmath195 , namely with @xmath196 and @xmath197 . in figs .",
    "[ rfspk05all ] and [ rfspk15all ] the evolution of @xmath7 is illustrated for @xmath197 and @xmath196 , respectively . in case of",
    "@xmath197 we have non - periodic mode of evolution for all @xmath10 , while for @xmath196 a negative @xmath10 gives a non - periodic mode of expansion .",
    "a non - negative @xmath10 in this case gives an ever expanding mode of evolution .",
    "we consider a self consistent system of nonlinear spinor and gravitational fields within the framework of bianchi type - i cosmological model filled with viscous fluid .",
    "the spinor filed nonlinearity is taken to be some power law of the invariants of bilinear spinor forms .",
    "solutions to the corresponding equations are given in terms of the volume scale of the bi space - time , i.e. , in terms of @xmath198 .",
    "the system of equations for determining @xmath7 , energy - density of the viscous fluid @xmath8 and hubble parameter @xmath114 has been worked out .",
    "exact solution to the aforementioned system has been given only for the case of bulk viscosity .",
    "as one sees from or , the system in question is a multi - parametric one and may have several solutions depending on the choice of the problem parameters .",
    "as one sees , solutions can be non - periodic independent to the sign of @xmath10 term . given the richness of we plan to give qualitative analysis of this system in near future ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we consider a system of nonlinear spinor and a bianchi type i gravitational fields in presence of viscous fluid . the nonlinear term in the spinor field lagrangian is chosen to be @xmath0 , with @xmath1 being a self - coupling constant and @xmath2 being a function of the invariants @xmath3 an @xmath4 constructed from bilinear spinor forms @xmath5 and @xmath6 . </S>",
    "<S> self - consistent solutions to the spinor and bi gravitational field equations are obtained in terms of @xmath7 , where @xmath7 is the volume scale of bi universe . </S>",
    "<S> system of equations for @xmath7 and @xmath8 , where @xmath8 is the energy of the viscous fluid , is deduced . </S>",
    "<S> this system is solved numerically for some special cases . </S>"
  ]
}
